sentences.english: The strongest , fastest winds of a hurricane are found in the eyewall.
sentences.chinese: 最強勁最快速的風在颶風的眼壁中。

sentences.english: Anger is a hurricane with the power to destroy.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒是擁有摧毀一切力量的颶風。

sentences.english: What if a hurricane comes along and obliterates the dunes entirely?
sentences.chinese: 如果刮來一場颶風把沙丘都清理乾淨了怎麼辦？

sentences.english: Hurricane forecasters expect this year's hurricane season to be busier than average.
sentences.chinese: 氣象預報員預計今年的颶風季會比往常更加頻繁。

sentences.english: The reduced wind shear means that upper-level winds are less likely to disrupt hurricane formation.
sentences.chinese: 減弱風切變意味着高空風不太可能影響颶風的形成。

sentences.english: And there is yet another possibility that Isidore could head toward the Yucatan Peninsula.
sentences.chinese: 還有一種可能就是颶風伊西多爾會侵襲尤卡坦半島。

sentences.english: If the hurricane had happened during the day-time , there would have been many more deaths.
sentences.chinese: 要是颶風發生在白天，那麼死亡人數將會更多。

sentences.english: "; and "What was the name of the hurricane that flooded New Orleans in 2005?".
sentences.chinese: 2005年卷席新奧爾良的颶風叫什麼？

sentences.english: The hurricane in 2005 brought an inconceivable disaster to New Oreland.
sentences.chinese: 2005年的颶風給新奧爾良市帶來不可想象的災難。

sentences.english: He says warm air over the atlantic will cause increased hurricane activity.
sentences.chinese: 他說，大西洋上空的暖空氣是造成嚴重的颶風的原因。

sentences.english: The nation soon realized that Katrina had won on both 3)counts.
sentences.chinese: 美國很快就瞭解卡崔娜颶風在這兩方面都是贏家。

sentences.english: Cyclone is awesome, but Resto druids and especially Feral druids have it .
sentences.chinese: 颶風真的很棒，但是恢復德甚至野德一樣有這個技能。

sentences.english: The vessel, although cleared at the custom house last week, is prevented from sailing by the hurricane.
sentences.chinese: 那隻船雖然上週結關了，但被颶風阻止了航行。

sentences.english: Hurricane Katrina wiped out nearly all of Waveland.
sentences.chinese: 卡特里娜颶風消滅了幾乎所有的韋夫蘭。

sentences.english: THE hurricane seeks the shortest road by the no-road.
sentences.chinese: 颶風藉以無路索求最短的行程。

sentences.english: Both polls were postponed because of Hurricane Gustav, which pounded Louisiana in September.
sentences.chinese: 兩次選舉均因爲颶風九月份襲擊路易斯安那州而推遲。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to carry along/to carry on one's person/to carry secretly
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
